etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Bald's Leechbook. Cognate with Middle Low German sprincwurt, Old High German sprincwurz (Middle High German springwurz, German Springwurz) from the Germanic base of spring + the Germanic base of wort, apparently so called with reference to the way the seeds of the caper spurge are ejected from their pods

definitions: Any of several plants typically used medicinally, especially caper spurge (Euphorbia lathyris, family Euphorbiaceae) and burnet (genera Sanguisorba and Sarcopoterium, family Rosaceae).
A mysterious herb having various magic powers.

notes.text: Sometimes identified with a medicinal plant.
